channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meet Ultra Skelly: Skelly the Skeleton Gets a High-Tech Edition This Halloween
item.description: The new 6'5'' version of Skelly has digital eyeballs, audio options, and a motion sensor. It’s available to buy starting today.

item.title: A Hiker Was Missing for Nearly a Year—Until an AI System Recognized His Helmet
item.description: Using AI to analyze thousands of frames taken by drone, The Piedmontese Alpine Rescue team has found the body of a doctor who had been missing since S...

item.title: The US Military Is Raking in Millions From On-Base Slot Machines
item.description: The Defense Department operates slot machines on US military bases overseas, raising millions of dollars to fund recreation for troops—and creating ri...

item.title: Mastercard denies pressuring game platforms, Valve tells a different story
item.description: Mastercard seemingly denied playing a role in a recent marketplace crackdown on games with adult content, while Valve says the pressure was indirect.

item.title: Inside OpenAI’s quest to make AI do anything for you
item.description: OpenAI developed the first AI reasoning model less than a year ago, but the technology has shifted Silicon Valley's focus to agents.

item.title: 19 Best Barefoot Shoes for Running or Walking (2025), Tested and Reviewed
item.description: Our favorite zero-drop, minimalist footwear will let you feel the ground beneath your feet.

item.title: The uproar over Vogue’s AI-generated ad isn’t just about fashion
item.description: “Modeling as a profession is already challenging enough without having to compete with now new digital standards of perfection that can be achieved wi...

item.title: Apple might be building its own AI ‘answer engine’
item.description: Apple is reportedly working to create a lightweight competitor to ChatGPT.

item.title: The Nintendo Switch 2’s Biggest Problem Is Already Storage
item.description: In 2025, 256 gigabytes just isn’t enough, and tacking on more storage isn’t as easy as it sounds.

item.title: SAP is acquiring SmartRecruiters
item.description: SAP has reached an agreement to acquire SmartRecruiters, with SmartRecruiters' software complementing SAP's existing HR tools.
